page.title: 13Birds of the Woodland
page.content: On a warm day in spring,woodland birds are active nest building and sitting on their song posts defending their territories. Some are feeding young. Members of the tit and finch family were common in both types of woodland. Blue- tit, coal-tit,great- tit, goldfinch,greenfinch and chaffinch were seen and heard.A goldcrest was seen in a coniferous plantation.A good view of a blackcap thrilled everyone.A coal-tit was seen disappearing into its nest in a hole in a wall.Other birds included wood pigeon,crow, magpie,tree creeper, blackbird, song thrush,mistlethrush, wren,pheasant and willow warbler.
